result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Morrison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 60 days; alternate 12 days jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James A Morrison in court with attorney Shad Aaron Merwin.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Prosecuting attorney moves to amend Ct. 1 to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Prosecuting attorney moves to amend Ct. 3  to Possess Drug Paraphernalia contrary to section 13.102(c)(14)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered. Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following:
- Ct. 1:  $582.50 to be paid within 60 days; alternate 12 days jail - consecutive
- Ct. 3:  $582.50 to be paid within 60 days; alternate 12 days jail - consecutive

Defendant James A Morrison in court with attorney Shad Aaron Merwin.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date to gather information to give to the DA's office. Court will give another date in 3 weeks. 
'  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant James A Morrison in court with attorney Shad Aaron Merwin.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has just received discovery and requests another date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant James A Morrison in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.
